Date: 26.8.2024
AvSec Order No. 10/2024

Subject; Security Measures for Company mail (COMAIL) and Company material
(Comat).

In exercise of powers conferred under rules 41,43 and 62 of the Aircraft (Security)
Rules, 2023, the Director General, Bureau of Civil Aviation Security, for the purpose of
the safety and security of passengers, crew, ground personnel and general public in all
matters relating to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation,
directs for security measures to be applied on Company mail (COMAIL) and Company
material (COMAT).

2. Objective: To comply with the relevant Standards of Annex 17 to the International
Convention on Civil Aviation and to secure COMAIL & COMAT intended to be carried by
commercial air transport operation

3. Scope: Security measures prescribed in this document shall be applicable to all
the aircraft operators operating to and from India

4, Security measures for COMAT and COMAIL: The following security measures
shall be applied:

(a) COMAT and COMAIL shall be subjected to screening by ASG while entering
inside the SRA of airport.

(b) If COMAT and COMAIL is to be carried in the hold of the aircraft, those shall
be screened by the airport operator/aircraft operator (as the case may be]

(c) COMAT and COMAIL transported through cargo facility shall undergo the same
security procedure as that applicable to cargo and mail.

5. This AVSEC Order supersedes AO 10/2011 issued on 25.1.2011
6. The above directions shall be implemented by all concerned entities with immediate

effect. Any violation of this AVSEC Order shall attract a penalty under provisions of the
Aircraft (Security) Rules, 2023.
